      • formatStringLikePhoneNumber

        public static java.lang.String formatStringLikePhoneNumber(java.lang.String str)
        This will format a String passed in (7145551234) and convert it into standard US phone number formatting ((714) 555-1234)
        Parameters:
        str - String to be converted
        Returns:
        Converted String

      • convertNameToPhoneNumber

        public static java.lang.String convertNameToPhoneNumber(java.lang.String str)
        Takes in a String and converts it to a number matching a phone number type. Example would be you send int "ABC", it will return "222" as on a phone dial screen, ABC are all on the 2 key.
        Parameters:
        str - String to parse
        Returns:
        String of numbers to match converted number

      • convertNumberToStringList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertNumberToStringList(java.lang.String str,
                                                                         boolean includeBothCases)
        Takes in a String and converts it to a string list matching a query using a phone keypad. An example would be, send in 728 and it would return a list containing: {"PQRS", "ABC", "TUV"}
        Parameters:
        str - String to parse into an integer. If it fails int parsing, returns null
        includeBothCases - Boolean, if true, it will add both upper and lower cases to string list. IE, 728 would return: {"PpQqRrSs","AaBbCc","TtUuVv"}
        Returns:
        List of Strings to match converted number

      • convertStringToBoolean

        public static java.lang.Boolean convertStringToBoolean(java.lang.String str)
        Checks a String to see if it can be easilly converted to a boolean. If it can be, it will be returned as true or false, else, it will return null.
        Parameters:
        str - String to check
        Returns:
        Boolean, true or false, null if it cannot be parsed

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Return true if it is numeric, false if it is not

      • getAbsolutePath

        public static java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(Context context,
                                               android.net.Uri uri)
        Using code from this link: http://hmkcode.com/android-display-selected-image-and-its-real-path/ This method will return the absolute path Android.net.Uri. NOTE!!! THIS DOES NOT SUPPORT API 10 OR BELOW!!! IF YOU NEED TO WORK WITH THAT, CHECK LINK ABOVE
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        uri - Uri to check
        Returns:
        String for the absolute path

      • buildAStringFromUnknowns

        public static java.lang.String buildAStringFromUnknowns(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                        java.lang.String delimiter)
        Builds a String via the passed String array. If the individual String is null or empty, it skips it. If the delimiter is empty, skips that too
        Parameters:
        args - String array to use
        delimiter - Delimiter to use (IE , or a space or _ or / or | )
        Returns:
        Fully completed and written String. Example: String str = buildAStringFromUnknowns(new String[]{"2016", "07", "04"}, "/"); str would print as: "2016/07/04"

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • anyNullsOrEmptyInStrings

        public static boolean anyNullsOrEmptyInStrings(java.lang.String[] args)
        Checks if any of the Strings passed via an array are null or are empty ("");
        Parameters:
        args - String array to check
        Returns:
        boolean, true of any are null or are empty

      • getPath

        public static java.lang.String getPath(Context context,
                                       Uri uri)
        From - http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19985286/convert-content-uri-to-actual-path-in-android-4-4 Get a file path from a Uri. This will get the the path for Storage Access Framework Documents, as well as the _data field for the MediaStore and OTHER file-based ContentProviders.
        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        uri - The Uri to query.

      • getDataColumn

        public static java.lang.String getDataColumn(Context context,
                                             Uri uri,
                                             java.lang.String selection,
                                             java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Get the value of the data column for this Uri. This is useful for MediaStore Uris, and OTHER file-based ContentProviders.
        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        uri - The Uri to query.
        selection - (Optional) Filter used in the query.
        selectionArgs - (Optional) Selection arguments used in the query.
        Returns:
        The value of the _data column, which is typically a file path.

      • isCurseWord

        public static boolean isCurseWord(Context context,
                                  java.lang.String str)
        Checks for curse words in the String
        Parameters:
        str - String to compare against.
        Returns:
        True if it matches a curse word, false it it does not. NOTE! This will not check for contains, only equals. The reason for this is because if you have something like the word "assistant" the first 3 letters will trigger this to return true.
